text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the beginning with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things came into being through Him, and apart from Him not even one thing came into being that has come into being.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Him was life, and the life was the Light of mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not grasp it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man came, one sent from God, and his name was John.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came as a witness, to testify about the Light, so that all might believe through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was not the Light, but he came to testify about the Light.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the true Light that, coming into the world, enlightens every person.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the world, and the world came into being through Him, and yet the world did not know Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to His own, and His own people did not accept Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe in His name,
speaker: Narrator

text: who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of a man, but of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us; and we saw His glory, glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: John testified about Him and called out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who is coming after me has proved to be my superior, because He existed before me.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For of His fullness we have all received, and grace upon grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Law was given through Moses; grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has seen God at any time; God the only Son, who is in the arms of the Father, He has explained Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites to him from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he confessed and did not deny; and this is what he confessed: “I am not the Christ.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And so they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” And he said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to him, “Who are you? Tell us, so that we may give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I am the voice of one calling out in the wilderness, ‘Make the way of the Lord straight,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the messengers had been sent from the Pharisees.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, and said to him, “Why then are you baptizing, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered them, saying, “I baptize in water, but among you stands One whom you do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is He who comes after me, of whom I am not worthy even to untie the strap of His sandal.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day he saw Jesus coming to him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
speaker: Narrator

text: This is He in behalf of whom I said, ‘After me is coming a Man who has proved to be my superior, because He existed before me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And I did not recognize Him, but so that He would be revealed to Israel, I came baptizing in water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And John testified, saying, “I have seen the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven, and He remained upon Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I did not recognize Him, but He who sent me to baptize in water said to me, ‘He upon whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining upon Him, this is the One who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And I myself have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the next day John was standing with two of his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he looked at Jesus as He walked, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus turned and saw them following, and said to them, “What are you seeking?” They said to Him, “Rabbi (which translated means Teacher), where are You staying?”
speaker: Jesus

text: He said to them, “Come, and you will see.” So they came and saw where He was staying, and they stayed with Him that day; it was about the tenth hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: He first found his own brother Simon and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which translated means Christ).
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon the son of John; you shall be called Cephas” (which is translated Peter).
speaker: Jesus

text: The next day He decided to go to Galilee, and He found Philip. And Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses wrote in the Law, and the prophets also wrote: Jesus the son of Joseph, from Nazareth!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good be from Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him, and said of him, “Here is truly an Israelite, in whom there is no deceit!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael answered Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God; You are the King of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you that I saw you under the fig tree, do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And He said to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”
speaker: Jesus

text: On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there;
speaker: Narrator

text: and both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to her, “What business do you have with Me, woman? My hour has not yet come.”
speaker: Jesus

text: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He tells you, do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were six stone waterpots standing there for the Jewish custom of purification, containing two or three measures each.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Fill the waterpots with water.” So they filled them up to the brim.
speaker: Jesus

text: And He said to them, “Draw some out now and take it to the headwaiter.” And they took it to him.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when the headwaiter tasted the water which had become wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the headwaiter called the groom,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Every man serves the good wine first, and when the guests are drunk, then he serves the poorer wine; but you have kept the good wine until now.”
speaker: Jesus

text: This beginning of His signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and revealed His glory; and His disciples believed in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this He went down to Capernaum, He and His mother, and His brothers and His disciples; and they stayed there a few days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Passover of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And within the temple grounds He found those who were selling oxen, sheep, and doves, and the money changers seated at their tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He made a whip of cords, and drove them all out of the temple area, with the sheep and the oxen; and He poured out the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to those who were selling the doves He said, “Take these things away from here; stop making My Father’s house a place of business!”
speaker: Jesus

text: His disciples remembered that it was written: “Zeal for Your house will consume me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then said to Him, “What sign do You show us as Your authority for doing these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The Jews then said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple, and yet You will raise it up in three days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He was speaking about the temple of His body.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when He was raised from the dead, His disciples remembered that He said this; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in His name as they observed His signs which He was doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, on His part, was not entrusting Himself to them, because He knew all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: and because He did not need anyone to testify about mankind, for He Himself knew what was in mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews;
speaker: Narrator

text: this man came to Jesus at night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You have come from God as a teacher; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus responded and said to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless someone is born again he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a person be born when he is old? He cannot enter his mother’s womb a second time and be born, can he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless someone is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: That which has been born of the flesh is flesh, and that which has been born of the Spirit is spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be amazed that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
speaker: Jesus

text: The wind blows where it wishes, and you hear the sound of it, but you do not know where it is coming from and where it is going; so is everyone who has been born of the Spirit.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus responded and said to Him, “How can these things be?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, “You are the teacher of Israel, and yet you do not understand these things?
speaker: Jesus

text: Truly, truly, I say to you, we speak of what we know and testify of what we have seen, and you people do not accept our testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: If I told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
speaker: Jesus

text: No one has ascended into heaven, except He who descended from heaven: the Son of Man.
speaker: Jesus

text: And just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that everyone who believes will have eternal life in Him.
speaker: Jesus

text: “For God so loved the world, that He gave His only Son, so that everyone who believes in Him will not perish, but have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but so that the world might be saved through Him.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who believes in Him is not judged; the one who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And this is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and people loved the darkness rather than the Light; for their deeds were evil.
speaker: Jesus

text: For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light, so that his deeds will not be exposed.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the one who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds will be revealed as having been performed in God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea; and there He was spending time with them and baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now John also was baptizing in Aenon, near Salim, because there was an abundance of water there; and people were coming and being baptized—
speaker: Narrator

text: for John had not yet been thrown into prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a matter of dispute developed on the part of John’s disciples with a Jew about purification.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified—behold, He is baptizing and all the people are coming to Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John replied, “A person can receive not even one thing unless it has been given to him from heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: You yourselves are my witnesses that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent ahead of Him.’
speaker: Jesus

text: He who has the bride is the groom; but the friend of the groom, who stands and listens to him, rejoices greatly because of the groom’s voice. So this joy of mine has been made full.
speaker: Jesus

text: He must increase, but I must decrease.
speaker: Jesus

text: “He who comes from above is above all; the one who is only from the earth is of the earth and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
speaker: Jesus

text: What He has seen and heard, of this He testifies; and no one accepts His testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who has accepted His testimony has certified that God is true.
speaker: Jesus

text: For He whom God sent speaks the words of God; for He does not give the Spirit sparingly.
speaker: Jesus

text: The Father loves the Son and has entrusted all things to His hand.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who believes in the Son has eternal life; but the one who does not obey the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that He was making and baptizing more disciples than John
speaker: Narrator

text: (although Jesus Himself was not baptizing; rather, His disciples were),
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Judea and went away again to Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He had to pass through Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He came to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near the parcel of land that Jacob gave to his son Joseph;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jacob’s well was there. So Jesus, tired from His journey, was just sitting by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For His disciples had gone away to the city to buy food.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Samaritan woman said to Him, “How is it that You, though You are a Jew, are asking me for a drink, though I am a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews do not associate with Samaritans.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied to her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who is saying to you, ‘Give Me a drink,’ you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said to Him, “Sir, You have no bucket and the well is deep; where then do You get this living water?
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not greater than our father Jacob, are You, who gave us the well and drank of it himself, and his sons and his cattle?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again;
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him shall never be thirsty; but the water that I will give him will become in him a fountain of water springing up to eternal life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water so that I will not be thirsty, nor come all the way here to draw water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to her, “Go, call your husband and come here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman answered and said to Him, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You have correctly said, ‘I have no husband’;
speaker: Narrator

text: for you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband; this which you have said is true.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and yet you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where one must worship.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Believe Me, woman, that a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: You Samaritans worship what you do not know; we worship what we do know, because salvation is from the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a time is coming, and even now has arrived, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; for such people the Father seeks to be His worshipers.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and truth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming (He who is called Christ); when that One comes, He will declare all things to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “I am He, the One speaking to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And at this point His disciples came, and they were amazed that He had been speaking with a woman, yet no one said, “What are You seeking?” or, “Why are You speaking with her?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the woman left her waterpot and went into the city, and said to the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come, see a Man who told me all the things that I have done; this is not the Christ, is He?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They left the city and were coming to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile the disciples were urging Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat something.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples were saying to one another, “No one brought Him anything to eat, did he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to accomplish His work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not say, ‘There are still four months, and then comes the harvest’? Behold, I tell you, raise your eyes and observe the fields, that they are white for harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Already the one who reaps is receiving wages and is gathering fruit for eternal life, so that the one who sows and the one who reaps may rejoice together.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in this case the saying is true: ‘One sows and another reaps.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored, and you have come into their labor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now from that city many of the Samaritans believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all the things that I have done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the Samaritans came to Jesus, they were asking Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many more believed because of His word;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they were saying to the woman, “It is no longer because of what you said that we believe, for we have heard for ourselves and know that this One truly is the Savior of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the two days, He departed from there for Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, only because they had seen all the things that He did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they themselves also went to the feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore He came again to Cana of Galilee, where He had made the water into wine. And there was a royal official whose son was sick at Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and began asking Him to come down and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders, you simply will not believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The royal official said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Go; your son is alive.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and went home.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he was now going down, his slaves met him, saying that his son was alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. Then they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son is alive”; and he himself believed, and his entire household.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is again a second sign that Jesus performed when He had come from Judea into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in Jerusalem, by the Sheep Gate, there is a pool which in Hebrew is called Bethesda, having five porticoes.
speaker: Narrator

text: In these porticoes lay a multitude of those who were sick, blind, limping, or paralyzed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a man was there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, upon seeing this man lying there and knowing that he had already been in that condition for a long time, said to him, “Do you want to get well?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Get up, pick up your pallet and walk.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Immediately the man became well, and picked up his pallet and began to walk.
Now it was a Sabbath on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews were saying to the man who was cured, “It is a Sabbath, and it is not permissible for you to carry your pallet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “He who made me well was the one who said to me, ‘Pick up your pallet and walk.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, “Who is the Man who said to you, ‘Pick it up and walk’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had slipped away while there was a crowd in that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward, Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “Behold, you have become well; do not sin anymore, so that nothing worse happens to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man went away, and informed the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason the Jews were persecuting Jesus, because He was doing these things on a Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered them, “My Father is working until now, and I Myself am working.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason therefore the Jews were seeking all the more to kill Him, because He not only was breaking the Sabbath, but also was calling God His own Father, making Himself equal with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jesus answered and was saying to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, unless it is something He sees the Father doing; for whatever the Father does, these things the Son also does in the same way.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Father loves the Son and shows Him all things that He Himself is doing; and the Father will show Him greater works than these, so that you will be amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so the Son also gives life to whom He wishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For not even the Father judges anyone, but He has given all judgment to the Son,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all will honor the Son just as they honor the Father. The one who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Truly, truly, I say to you, the one who hears My word, and believes Him who sent Me, has eternal life, and does not come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly, I say to you, a time is coming and even now has arrived, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as the Father has life in Himself, so He gave to the Son also to have life in Himself;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He gave Him authority to execute judgment, because He is the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be amazed at this; for a time is coming when all who are in the tombs will hear His voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and will come out: those who did the good deeds to a resurrection of life, those who committed the bad deeds to a resurrection of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I can do nothing on My own. As I hear, I judge; and My judgment is righteous, because I do not seek My own will but the will of Him who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If I alone testify about Myself, My testimony is not true.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is another who testifies about Me, and I know that the testimony which He gives about Me is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have sent messengers to John, and he has testified to the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the testimony I receive is not from man, but I say these things so that you may be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was the lamp that was burning and shining, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the testimony I have is greater than the testimony of John; for the works which the Father has given Me to accomplish—the very works that I do—testify about Me, that the Father has sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Father who sent Me, He has testified about Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His form.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also you do not have His word remaining in you, because you do not believe Him whom He sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: You examine the Scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life; and it is those very Scriptures that testify about Me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and yet you are unwilling to come to Me so that you may have life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not receive glory from people;
speaker: Narrator

text: but I know you, that you do not have the love of God in yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have come in My Father’s name, and you do not receive Me; if another comes in his own name, you will receive him.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can you believe, when you accept glory from one another and you do not seek the glory that is from the one and only God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father; the one who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have put your hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe Me; for he wrote about Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?”
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus went away to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (or Tiberias).
speaker: Narrator

text: A large crowd was following Him, because they were watching the signs which He was performing on those who were sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus went up on the mountain, and there He sat with His disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus, after raising His eyes and seeing that a large crowd was coming to Him, said to Philip, “Where are we to buy bread so that these people may eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He was saying this only to test him, for He Himself knew what He intended to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not enough for them, for each to receive just a little!”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish; but what are these for so many people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Have the people recline to eat.” Now there was plenty of grass in the place. So the men reclined, about five thousand in number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then took the loaves, and after giving thanks He distributed them to those who were reclining; likewise also of the fish, as much as they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had eaten their fill, He said to His disciples, “Gather up the leftover pieces so that nothing will be lost.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with pieces from the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when the people saw the sign which He had performed, they said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus, aware that they intended to come and take Him by force to make Him king, withdrew again to the mountain by Himself, alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and after getting into a boat, they started to cross the sea to Capernaum. It had already become dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition, the sea began getting rough, because a strong wind was blowing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, when they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat; and they were frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “It is I; do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were willing to take Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land to which they were going.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day the crowd that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other small boat there except one, and that Jesus had not gotten into the boat with His disciples, but that His disciples had departed alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other small boats came from Tiberias near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the crowd saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they themselves got into the small boats and came to Capernaum, looking for Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You get here?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them and said, “Truly, truly, I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate some of the loaves and were filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not work for the food that perishes, but for the food that lasts for eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you, for on Him the Father, God, has set His seal.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they said to Him, “What are we to do, so that we may accomplish the works of God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in Him whom He has sent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to Him, “What then are You doing as a sign, so that we may see, and believe You? What work are You performing?
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness; as it is written: ‘He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, it is not Moses who has given you the bread out of heaven, but it is My Father who gives you the true bread out of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bread of God is that which comes down out of heaven and gives life to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to Him, “Lord, always give us this bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; the one who comes to Me will not be hungry, and the one who believes in Me will never be thirsty.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said to you that you have indeed seen Me, and yet you do not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything that the Father gives Me will come to Me, and the one who comes to Me I certainly will not cast out.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the will of Him who sent Me, that of everything that He has given Me I will lose nothing, but will raise it up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is the will of My Father, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in Him will have eternal life, and I Myself will raise him up on the last day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then the Jews were complaining about Him because He said, “I am the bread that came down out of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were saying, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How does He now say, ‘I have come down out of heaven’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Stop complaining among yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him; and I will raise him up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is written in the Prophets: ‘And they shall all be taught of God.’ Everyone who has heard and learned from the Father, comes to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except the One who is from God; He has seen the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly, I say to you, the one who believes has eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the bread of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread that comes down out of heaven, so that anyone may eat from it and not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the living bread that came down out of heaven; if anyone eats from this bread, he will live forever; and the bread which I will give for the life of the world also is My flesh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews began to argue with one another, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For My flesh is true food, and My blood is true drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who eats My flesh and drinks My blood remains in Me, and I in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, the one who eats Me, he also will live because of Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread that came down out of heaven, not as the fathers ate and died; the one who eats this bread will live forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then many of His disciples, when they heard this, said, “This statement is very unpleasant; who can listen to it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, aware that His disciples were complaining about this, said to them, “Is this offensive to you?
speaker: Narrator

text: What then if you see the Son of Man ascending to where He was before?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh provides no benefit; the words that I have spoken to you are spirit, and are life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who it was who would betray Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying, “For this reason I have told you that no one can come to Me unless it has been granted him from the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result of this many of His disciples left, and would no longer walk with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to the twelve, “You do not want to leave also, do you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have words of eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we have already believed and have come to know that You are the Holy One of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Did I Myself not choose you, the twelve? And yet one of you is a devil.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He meant Judas the son of Simon Iscariot; for he, one of the twelve, was going to betray Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus was walking in Galilee, for He was unwilling to walk in Judea because the Jews were seeking to kill Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So His brothers said to Him, “Move on from here and go into Judea, so that Your disciples also may see Your works which You are doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For no one does anything in secret when he himself is striving to be known publicly. If You are doing these things, show Yourself to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For not even His brothers believed in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to them, “My time is not yet here, but your time is always ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me because I testify about it, that its deeds are evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up to the feast yourselves; I am not going up to this feast, because My time has not yet fully arrived.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now having said these things to them, He stayed in Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when His brothers had gone up to the feast, then He Himself also went up, not publicly, but as though in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews were looking for Him at the feast and saying, “Where is He?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a great deal of talk about Him in secret among the crowds: some were saying, “He is a good man”; others were saying, “No, on the contrary, He is misleading the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: However, no one was speaking openly about Him, for fear of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when it was now the middle of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple area, and began to teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then were astonished, saying, “How has this Man become learned, not having been educated?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus answered them and said, “My teaching is not My own, but His who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone is willing to do His will, he will know about the teaching, whether it is of God, or I am speaking from Myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but He who is seeking the glory of the One who sent Him, He is true, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Did Moses not give you the Law, and yet none of you carries out the Law? Why are you seeking to kill Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd answered, “You have a demon! Who is seeking to kill You?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I did one deed, and you all are astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason Moses has given you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and even on a Sabbath you circumcise a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man receives circumcision on a Sabbath so that the Law of Moses will not be broken, are you angry at Me because I made an entire man well on a Sabbath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not judge by the outward appearance, but judge with righteous judgment.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So some of the people of Jerusalem were saying, “Is this Man not the one whom they are seeking to kill?
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet look, He is speaking publicly, and they are saying nothing to Him. The rulers do not really know that this is the Christ, do they?
speaker: Narrator

text: However, we know where this Man is from; but when the Christ comes, no one knows where He is from.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus cried out in the temple, teaching and saying, “You both know Me and you know where I am from; and I have not come of Myself, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do know Him, because I am from Him, and He sent Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were seeking to arrest Him; and yet no one laid a hand on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: But many of the crowd believed in Him; and they were saying, “When the Christ comes, He will not perform more signs than those which this man has done, will He?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering these things about Him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jesus said, “For a little while longer I am going to be with you, and then I am going to Him who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will seek Me, and will not find Me; and where I am, you cannot come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then said to one another, “Where does this Man intend to go that we will not find Him? He does not intend to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks, does He?
speaker: Narrator

text: What is this statement that He said, ‘You will seek Me, and will not find Me; and where I am, you cannot come’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the last day, the great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, saying, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who believes in Me, as the Scripture said, ‘From his innermost being will flow rivers of living water.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: But this He said in reference to the Spirit, whom those who believed in Him were to receive; for the Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the people therefore, after they heard these words, were saying, “This truly is the Prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others were saying, “This is the Christ.” But others were saying, “Surely the Christ is not coming from Galilee, is He?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has the Scripture not said that the Christ comes from the descendants of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So a dissension occurred in the crowd because of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of them wanted to arrest Him, but no one laid hands on Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers then came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, “Why did you not bring Him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers answered, “Never has a man spoken in this way!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees then replied to them, “You have not been led astray too, have you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Not one of the rulers or Pharisees has believed in Him, has he?
speaker: Narrator

text: But this crowd that does not know the Law is accursed!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nicodemus (the one who came to Him before, being one of them) said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our Law does not judge the person unless it first hears from him and knows what he is doing, does it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said to him, “You are not from Galilee as well, are you? Examine the Scriptures, and see that no prophet arises out of Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone went to his home.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And early in the morning He came again into the temple area, and all the people were coming to Him; and He sat down and began teaching them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman caught in the act of adultery, and after placing her in the center of the courtyard,
speaker: Narrator

text: they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman has been caught in the very act of committing adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the Law, Moses commanded us to stone such women; what then do You say?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they were saying this to test Him, so that they might have grounds for accusing Him. But Jesus stooped down and with His finger wrote on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they persisted in asking Him, He straightened up and said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him be the first to throw a stone at her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they heard this, they began leaving, one by one, beginning with the older ones, and He was left alone, and the woman where she was, in the center of the courtyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And straightening up, Jesus said to her, “Woman, where are they? Did no one condemn you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said, “I do not condemn you, either. Go. From now on do not sin any longer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus again spoke to them, saying, “I am the Light of the world; the one who follows Me will not walk in the darkness, but will have the Light of life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Pharisees said to Him, “You are testifying about Yourself; Your testimony is not true.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Even if I am testifying about Myself, My testimony is true, because I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from or where I am going.
speaker: Narrator

text: You judge according to the flesh; I am not judging anyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even if I do judge, My judgment is true; for I am not alone in it, but I and the Father who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in your Law it has been written that the testimony of two people is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am He who testifies about Myself, and the Father who sent Me testifies about Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were saying to Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father; if you knew Me, you would know My Father also.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These words He spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple area; and no one arrested Him, because His hour had not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said again to them, “I am going away, and you will look for Me, and will die in your sin; where I am going, you cannot come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews were saying, “Surely He will not kill Himself, will He, since He says, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “You are from below, I am from above; you are of this world, I am not of this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; for unless you believe that I am, you will die in your sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they were saying to Him, “Who are You?” Jesus said to them, “What have I even been saying to you from the beginning?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have many things to say and to judge regarding you, but He who sent Me is true; and the things which I heard from Him, these I say to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not realize that He was speaking to them about the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am, and I do nothing on My own, but I say these things as the Father instructed Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He who sent Me is with Me; He has not left Me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As He said these things, many came to believe in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus was saying to those Jews who had believed Him, “If you continue in My word, then you are truly My disciples;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s descendants and have never been enslaved to anyone; how is it that You say, ‘You will become free’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly I say to you, everyone who commits sin is a slave of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the slave does not remain in the house forever; the son does remain forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if the Son sets you free, you really will be free.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that you are Abraham’s descendants; yet you are seeking to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak of the things which I have seen with My Father; therefore you also do the things which you heard from your father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them, “If you are Abraham’s children, do the deeds of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as it is, you are seeking to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God; this Abraham did not do.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are doing the deeds of your father.” They said to Him, “We were not born as a result of sexual immorality; we have one Father: God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I came forth from God and am here; for I have not even come on My own, but He sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you not understand what I am saying? It is because you cannot listen to My word.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are of your father the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth because there is no truth in him. Whenever he tells a lie, he speaks from his own nature, because he is a liar and the father of lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: But because I say the truth, you do not believe Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which one of you convicts Me of sin? If I speak truth, why do you not believe Me?
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who is of God hears the words of God; for this reason you do not hear them, because you are not of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered and said to Him, “Do we not rightly say that You are a Samaritan, and You have a demon?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon; on the contrary, I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am not seeking My glory; there is One who seeks it, and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly I say to you, if anyone follows My word, he will never see death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets as well; and yet You say, ‘If anyone follows My word, he will never taste of death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not greater than our father Abraham, who died, are You? The prophets died too. Whom do You make Yourself out to be?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “If I glorify Myself, My glory is nothing; it is My Father who glorifies Me, of whom you say, ‘He is our God’;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you have not come to know Him, but I know Him. And if I say that I do not know Him, I will be a liar like you; but I do know Him, and I follow His word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your father Abraham was overjoyed that he would see My day, and he saw it and rejoiced.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and You have seen Abraham?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, before Abraham was born, I am.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they picked up stones to throw at Him, but Jesus hid Himself and left the temple grounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus passed by, He saw a man who had been blind from birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And His disciples asked Him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he would be born blind?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “It was neither that this man sinned, nor his parents; but it was so that the works of God might be displayed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We must carry out the works of Him who sent Me as long as it is day; night is coming, when no one can work.
speaker: Narrator

text: While I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had said this, He spit on the ground, and made mud from the saliva, and applied the mud to his eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated, Sent). So he left and washed, and came back seeing.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the neighbors, and those who previously saw him as a beggar, were saying, “Is this not the one who used to sit and beg?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others were saying, “This is he,” still others were saying, “No, but he is like him.” The man himself kept saying, “I am the one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were saying to him, “How then were your eyes opened?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “The Man who is called Jesus made mud, and spread it on my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash’; so I went away and washed, and I received sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to him, “Where is He?” He said, “I do not know.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the man who was previously blind to the Pharisees.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was a Sabbath on the day that Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees also were asking him again how he received his sight. And he said to them, “He applied mud to my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore some of the Pharisees were saying, “This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath.” But others were saying, “How can a man who is a sinner perform such signs?” And there was dissension among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said again to the man who was blind, “What do you say about Him, since He opened your eyes?” And he said, “He is a prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then did not believe it about him, that he had been blind and had received sight, until they called the parents of the very one who had received his sight,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they questioned them, saying, “Is this your son, who you say was born blind? Then how does he now see?”
speaker: Narrator

text: His parents then answered and said, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
speaker: Narrator

text: but how he now sees, we do not know; or who opened his eyes, we do not know. Ask him; he is of age, he will speak for himself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jews; for the Jews had already reached the decision that if anyone confessed Him to be Christ, he was to be excommunicated from the synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was for this reason that his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So for a second time they summoned the man who had been blind, and said to him, “Give glory to God; we know that this Man is a sinner.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He then answered, “Whether He is a sinner, I do not know; one thing I do know, that though I was blind, now I see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to him, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “I told you already and you did not listen; why do you want to hear it again? You do not want to become His disciples too, do you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They spoke abusively to him and said, “You are His disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that God has spoken to Moses, but as for this Man, we do not know where He is from.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man answered and said to them, “Well, here is the amazing thing, that you do not know where He is from, and yet He opened my eyes!
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that God does not listen to sinners; but if someone is God-fearing and does His will, He listens to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since the beginning of time it has never been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a person born blind.
speaker: Narrator
