text: “If you love Me, you will keep My commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will ask the Father, and He will give you another Helper, so that He may be with you forever;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Helper is the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it does not see Him or know Him; but you know Him because He remains with you and will be in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will not leave you as orphans; I am coming to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: After a little while, the world no longer is going to see Me, but you are going to see Me; because I live, you also will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day you will know that I am in My Father, and you are in Me, and I in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who has My commandments and keeps them is the one who loves Me; and the one who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and will reveal Myself to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Lord, what has happened that You are going to reveal Yourself to us and not to the world?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, “If anyone loves Me, he will follow My word; and My Father will love him, and We will come to him and make Our dwelling with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who does not love Me does not follow My words; and the word which you hear is not Mine, but the Father’s who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These things I have spoken to you while remaining with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit whom the Father will send in My name, He will teach you all things, and remind you of all that I said to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace I leave you, My peace I give you; not as the world gives, do I give to you. Do not let your hearts be troubled, nor fearful.
speaker: Narrator

text: You heard that I said to you, ‘I am going away, and I am coming to you.’ If you loved Me, you would have rejoiced because I am going to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I have told you before it happens, so that when it happens, you may believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not speak much more with you, for the ruler of the world is coming, and he has nothing in regard to Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: but so that the world may know that I love the Father, I do exactly as the Father commanded Me. Get up, let’s go from here.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every branch in Me that does not bear fruit, He takes away; and every branch that bears fruit, He prunes it so that it may bear more fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are already clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remain in Me, and I in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit of itself but must remain in the vine, so neither can you unless you remain in Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the vine, you are the branches; the one who remains in Me, and I in him bears much fruit, for apart from Me you can do nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone does not remain in Me, he is thrown away like a branch and dries up; and they gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you remain in Me, and My words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: My Father is glorified by this, that you bear much fruit, and so prove to be My disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the Father has loved Me, I also have loved you; remain in My love.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you keep My commandments, you will remain in My love; just as I have kept My Father’s commandments and remain in His love.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I have spoken to you so that My joy may be in you, and that your joy may be made full.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is My commandment, that you love one another, just as I have loved you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greater love has no one than this, that a person will lay down his life for his friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are My friends if you do what I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: No longer do I call you slaves, for the slave does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, because all things that I have heard from My Father I have made known to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You did not choose Me but I chose you, and appointed you that you would go and bear fruit, and that your fruit would remain, so that whatever you ask of the Father in My name He may give to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: This I command you, that you love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If the world hates you, you know that it has hated Me before it hated you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you were of the world, the world would love you as its own; but because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, because of this the world hates you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A slave is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will persecute you as well; if they followed My word, they will follow yours also.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all these things they will do to you on account of My name, because they do not know the One who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who hates Me hates My Father also.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would not have sin; but now they have both seen and hated Me and My Father as well.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this has happened so that the word that is written in their Law will be fulfilled: ‘They hated Me for no reason.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Helper comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, namely, the Spirit of truth who comes from the Father, He will testify about Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you are testifying as well, because you have been with Me from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These things I have spoken to you so that you will not be led into sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will ban you from the synagogue, yet an hour is coming for everyone who kills you to think that he is offering a service to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things they will do because they have not known the Father nor Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these things I have spoken to you, so that when their hour comes, you may remember that I told you of them. However, I did not say these things to you at the beginning, because I was with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But now I am going to Him who sent Me; and none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But because I have said these things to you, grief has filled your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you the truth: it is to your advantage that I am leaving; for if I do not leave, the Helper will not come to you; but if I go, I will send Him to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He, when He comes, will convict the world regarding sin, and righteousness, and judgment:
speaker: Narrator

text: regarding sin, because they do not believe in Me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and regarding righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you no longer are going to see Me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and regarding judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have many more things to say to you, but you cannot bear them at the present time.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when He, the Spirit of truth, comes, He will guide you into all the truth; for He will not speak on His own, but whatever He hears, He will speak; and He will disclose to you what is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will glorify Me, for He will take from Mine and will disclose it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things that the Father has are Mine; this is why I said that He takes from Mine and will disclose it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A little while, and you no longer are going to see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So some of His disciples said to one another, “What is this that He is telling us, ‘A little while, and you are not going to see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me’; and, ‘because I am going to the Father’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were saying, “What is this that He says, ‘A little while’? We do not know what He is talking about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew that they wanted to question Him, and He said to them, “Are you deliberating together about this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you are not going to see Me, and again a little while, and you will see Me’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly I say to you that you will weep and mourn, but the world will rejoice; you will grieve, but your grief will be turned into joy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever a woman is in labor she has pain, because her hour has come; but when she gives birth to the child, she no longer remembers the anguish because of the joy that a child has been born into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you too have grief now; but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one is going to take your joy away from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on that day you will not question Me about anything. Truly, truly I say to you, if you ask the Father for anything in My name, He will give it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until now you have asked for nothing in My name; ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be made full.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These things I have spoken to you in figures of speech; an hour is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly about the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day you will ask in My name, and I am not saying to you that I will request of the Father on your behalf;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me and have believed that I came forth from the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: I came forth from the Father and have come into the world; again, I am leaving the world and going to the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples said, “See, now You are speaking plainly and are not using any figure of speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we know that You know all things, and that You have no need for anyone to question You; this is why we believe that You came forth from God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied to them, “Do you now believe?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, an hour is coming, and has already come, for you to be scattered, each to his own home, and to leave Me alone; and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I have spoken to you so that in Me you may have peace. In the world you have tribulation, but take courage; I have overcome the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke these things; and raising His eyes to heaven, He said, “Father, the hour has come; glorify Your Son, so that the Son may glorify You,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as You gave Him authority over all mankind, so that to all whom You have given Him, He may give eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is eternal life, that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom You have sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: I glorified You on the earth by accomplishing the work which You have given Me to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now You, Father, glorify Me together with Yourself, with the glory which I had with You before the world existed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have revealed Your name to the men whom You gave Me out of the world; they were Yours and You gave them to Me, and they have followed Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they have come to know that everything which You have given Me is from You;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the words which You gave Me I have given to them; and they received them and truly understood that I came forth from You, and they believed that You sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I ask on their behalf; I do not ask on behalf of the world, but on the behalf of those whom You have given Me, because they are Yours;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all things that are Mine are Yours, and Yours are Mine; and I have been glorified in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am no longer going to be in the world; and yet they themselves are in the world, and I am coming to You. Holy Father, keep them in Your name, the name which You have given Me, so that they may be one just as We are.
speaker: Narrator

text: While I was with them, I was keeping them in Your name, which You have given Me; and I guarded them, and not one of them perished except the son of destruction, so that the Scripture would be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now I am coming to You; and these things I speak in the world so that they may have My joy made full in themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given them Your word; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not asking You to take them out of the world, but to keep them away from the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanctify them in the truth; Your word is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as You sent Me into the world, I also sent them into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for their sakes I sanctify Myself, so that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am not asking on behalf of these alone, but also for those who believe in Me through their word,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they may all be one; just as You, Father, are in Me and I in You, that they also may be in Us, so that the world may believe that You sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory which You have given Me I also have given to them, so that they may be one, just as We are one;
speaker: Narrator

text: I in them and You in Me, that they may be perfected in unity, so that the world may know that You sent Me, and You loved them, just as You loved Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Father, I desire that they also, whom You have given Me, be with Me where I am, so that they may see My glory which You have given Me, for You loved Me before the foundation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Righteous Father, although the world has not known You, yet I have known You; and these have known that You sent Me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I have made Your name known to them, and will make it known, so that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had spoken these words, He went away with His disciples across the ravine of the Kidron, where there was a garden which He entered with His disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Judas, who was betraying Him, also knew the place, because Jesus had often met there with His disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Judas, having obtained the Roman cohort and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were coming upon Him, came out into the open and said to them, “Whom are you seeking?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered Him, “Jesus the Nazarene.” He said to them, “I am He.” And Judas also, who was betraying Him, was standing with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, when He said to them, “I am He,” they drew back and fell to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: He then asked them again, “Whom are you seeking?” And they said, “Jesus the Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “I told you that I am He; so if you are seeking Me, let these men go on their way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This took place so that the word which He spoke would be fulfilled: “Of those whom You have given Me I lost not one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter, since he had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s slave, and cut off his right ear; and the slave’s name was Malchus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to Peter, “Put the sword into the sheath; the cup which the Father has given Me, am I not to drink it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Roman cohort, the commander, and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and brought Him to Annas first; for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it was in their best interest for one man to die in behalf of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter was following Jesus, and so was another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and he entered with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest,
speaker: Narrator

text: but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper, and brought Peter in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the slave woman who was the doorkeeper said to Peter, “You are not also one of this Man’s disciples, are you?” He said, “I am not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the slaves and the officers were standing there, having made a charcoal fire, for it was cold and they were warming themselves; and Peter was also with them, standing and warming himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high priest then questioned Jesus about His disciples, and about His teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “I have spoken openly to the world; I always taught in synagogues and in the temple area, where all the Jews congregate; and I said nothing in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why are you asking Me? Ask those who have heard what I spoke to them. Look: these people know what I said.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when He said this, one of the officers, who was standing nearby, struck Jesus, saying, “Is that the way You answer the high priest?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken wrongly, testify of the wrong; but if rightly, why do you strike Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Simon Peter was still standing and warming himself. So they said to him, “You are not one of His disciples as well, are you?” He denied it, and said, “I am not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the slaves of the high priest, who was related to the one whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter then denied it again, and immediately a rooster crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought Jesus from Caiaphas into the Praetorium, and it was early; and they themselves did not enter the Praetorium, so that they would not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Pilate came out to them and said, “What accusation are you bringing against this Man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said to him, “If this Man were not a criminal, we would not have handed Him over to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves, and judge Him according to your law.” The Jews said to him, “We are not permitted to put anyone to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened so that the word of Jesus which He said, indicating what kind of death He was going to die, would be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Pilate entered the Praetorium again, and summoned Jesus and said to Him, “You are the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Are you saying this on your own, or did others tell you about Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests handed You over to me; what have You done?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, My servants would be fighting so that I would not be handed over to the Jews; but as it is, My kingdom is not of this realm.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Pilate said to Him, “So You are a king?” Jesus answered, “You say correctly that I am a king. For this purpose I have been born, and for this I have come into the world: to testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to My voice.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pilate said to Him, “What is truth?”
And after saying this, he came out again to the Jews and said to them, “I find no grounds at all for charges in His case.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, you have a custom that I release one prisoner for you at the Passover; therefore do you wish that I release for you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shouted again, saying, “Not this Man, but Barabbas.” Now Barabbas was a rebel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate then took Jesus and had Him flogged.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers twisted together a crown of thorns and placed it on His head, and put a purple cloak on Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they repeatedly came up to Him and said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and slapped Him in the face again and again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then Pilate came out again and said to them, “See, I am bringing Him out to you so that you will know that I find no grounds at all for charges in His case.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said to them, “Behold, the Man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the chief priests and the officers saw Him, they shouted, saying, “Crucify, crucify!” Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves and crucify Him; for I find no grounds for charges in His case!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and by that law He ought to die, because He made Himself out to be the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when Pilate heard this statement, he was even more afraid;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he entered the Praetorium again and said to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate said to Him, “Are you not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have authority to release You, and I have authority to crucify You?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “You would have no authority over Me at all, if it had not been given to you from above; for this reason the one who handed Me over to you has the greater sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result of this, Pilate made efforts to release Him; but the Jews shouted, saying, “If you release this Man, you are not a friend of Caesar; everyone who makes himself out to be a king opposes Caesar!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called The Pavement—but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was the day of preparation for the Passover; it was about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, “Look, your King!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shouted, “Away with Him, away with Him, crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king except Caesar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he then handed Him over to them to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took Jesus, therefore, and He went out, carrying His own cross, to the place called the Place of a Skull, which in Hebrew is called, Golgotha.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they crucified Him, and with Him two other men, one on either side, and Jesus in between.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Pilate also wrote an inscription and put it on the cross. It was written: “JESUS THE NAZARENE, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore many of the Jews read this inscription, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, Latin, and in Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the chief priests of the Jews were saying to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews’; rather, write that He said, ‘I am King of the Jews.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took His outer garments and made four parts: a part to each soldier, and the tunic also; but the tunic was seamless, woven in one piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it, to decide whose it shall be.” This happened so that the Scripture would be fulfilled: “They divided My garments among themselves, and they cast lots for My clothing.” Therefore the soldiers did these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now beside the cross of Jesus stood His mother, His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when Jesus saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing nearby, He said to His mother, “Woman, behold, your son!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to the disciple, “Behold, your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own household.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Jesus, knowing that all things had already been accomplished, in order that the Scripture would be fulfilled, said, “I am thirsty.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A jar full of sour wine was standing there; so they put a sponge full of the sour wine on a branch of hyssop and brought it up to His mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished!” And He bowed His head and gave up His spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, since it was the day of preparation, to prevent the bodies from remaining on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews requested of Pilate that their legs be broken, and the bodies be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man, and of the other who was crucified with Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: but after they came to Jesus, when they saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true; and he knows that he is telling the truth, so that you also may believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these things took place so that the Scripture would be fulfilled: “Not a bone of Him shall be broken.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again another Scripture says, “They will look at Him whom they pierced.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after these things Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but a secret one for fear of the Jews, requested of Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate granted permission. So he came and took away His body.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nicodemus, who had first come to Him by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred litras weight.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took the body of Jesus and bound it in linen wrappings with the spices, as is the burial custom of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb in which no one had yet been laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore because of the Jewish day of preparation, since the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene came early to the tomb, while it was still dark, and saw the stone already removed from the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she ran and came to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken the Lord from the tomb, and we do not know where they have put Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter and the other disciple left, and they were going to the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two were running together; and the other disciple ran ahead, faster than Peter, and came to the tomb first;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he stooped to look in, and saw the linen wrappings lying there; however he did not go in.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Simon Peter also came, following him, and he entered the tomb; and he looked at the linen wrappings lying there,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the face-cloth which had been on His head, not lying with the linen wrappings but folded up in a place by itself.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the other disciple who had first come to the tomb also entered then, and he saw and believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they did not yet understand the Scripture, that He must rise from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples went away again to their own homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Mary was standing outside the tomb, weeping; so as she wept, she stooped to look into the tomb;
speaker: Narrator

text: and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had been lying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they put Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and yet she did not know that it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?” Thinking that He was the gardener, she said to Him, “Sir, if you have carried Him away, tell me where you put Him, and I will take Him away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned and said to Him in Hebrew, “Rabboni!” (which means, Teacher).
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Stop clinging to Me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father; but go to My brothers and say to them, ‘I am ascending to My Father and your Father, and My God and your God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene came and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and that He had said these things to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when it was evening on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were shut where the disciples were together due to fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in their midst, and said to them, “Peace be to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had said this, He showed them both His hands and His side. The disciples then rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be to you; just as the Father has sent Me, I also send you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had said this, He breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you forgive the sins of any, their sins have been forgiven them; if you retain the sins of any, they have been retained.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, who was called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the other disciples were saying to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see in His hands the imprint of the nails, and put my finger into the place of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Eight days later His disciples were again inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors having been shut, and stood in their midst and said, “Peace be to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to Thomas, “Place your finger here, and see My hands; and take your hand and put it into My side; and do not continue in disbelief, but be a believer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thomas answered and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Because you have seen Me, have you now believed? Blessed are they who did not see, and yet believed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, many other signs Jesus also performed in the presence of the disciples, which are not written in this book;
speaker: Narrator

text: but these have been written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that by believing you may have life in His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus revealed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and He revealed Himself in this way:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter, Thomas who was called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of His disciples were together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” They said to him, “We are also coming with you.” They went out and got into the boat; and that night they caught nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the day was now breaking, Jesus stood on the beach; yet the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to them, “Children, you do not have any fish to eat, do you?” They answered Him, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Cast the net on the right-hand side of the boat, and you will find the fish.” So they cast it, and then they were not able to haul it in because of the great quantity of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment (for he was stripped for work), and threw himself into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the other disciples came in the little boat, for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away, dragging the net full of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a charcoal fire already made and fish placed on it, and bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have now caught.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Simon Peter went up and hauled the net to land, full of large fish, 153; and although there were so many, the net was not torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Come and have breakfast.” None of the disciples ventured to inquire of Him, “Who are You?” knowing that it was the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and the fish likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was now the third time that Jesus revealed Himself to the disciples, after He was raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me more than these?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Tend My lambs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him again, a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Shepherd My sheep.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” Peter was hurt because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Tend My sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly I tell you, when you were younger, you used to put on your belt and walk wherever you wanted; but when you grow old, you will stretch out your hands and someone else will put your belt on you, and bring you where you do not want to go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He said this, indicating by what kind of death he would glorify God. And when He had said this, He said to him, “Follow Me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter turned around and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them—the one who also had leaned back on His chest at the supper and said, “Lord, who is the one who is betraying You?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter, upon seeing him, said to Jesus, “Lord, and what about this man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow Me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore this account went out among the brothers, that that disciple would not die; yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but only, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the disciple who is testifying about these things and wrote these things, and we know that his testimony is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there are also many other things which Jesus did, which, if they were written in detail, I expect that even the world itself would not contain the books that would be written.
speaker: Narrator
